importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the current state of the MLB postseason as of October 17, 2025.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The current point in the 2025 MLB postseason, marking key developments in the NLCS and ALCS, including the Dodgers' 3-1 lead and the Blue Jays tying the ALCS with the Mariners.

keyTakeAways: The Los Angeles Dodgers have a 3-0 lead in the NLCS against the Milwaukee Brewers and are one game away from securing their second consecutive World Series appearance, making them the first defending champion to do so in 16 years.
The Dodgers' path to the World Series includes a strong postseason run, including an 8-1 record with only one loss against the Philadelphia Phillies.
The Toronto Blue Jays have tied the American League Championship Series against the Seattle Mariners after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, making the series 2-2.
Max Scherzer, 41, pitched effectively in Game 4 of the ALCS, allowing only two runs and three hits in 5 2/3 innings, and Vladimir Guerrero Jr. homered in the game.
The Blue Jays are now in a pivotal position with momentum, having won four straight road games, and are aiming to take the series lead.
The Dodgers' chances of winning the World Series are high, with only the Boston Red Sox in 2004 having ever come back from a 3-0 deficit in a best-of-seven series.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the primary focus of the article, having advanced to the brink of a second consecutive World Series appearance after defeating the Milwaukee Brewers 3-1 in the NLCS.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers are the opposing team in the NLCS, and their loss of a 3-0 series lead makes them the obstacle the Dodgers must overcome to reach the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were the last team to achieve back-to-back World Series titles in 2009, and the Dodgers' current success echoes that historical achievement.

namedEntities.name: Boston Red Sox
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Sox are referenced as the only team to come back from a 3-0 deficit in a best-of-seven series, highlighting the rarity of such a comeback and the Dodgers’ high probability of winning the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners are the opposition in the ALCS, and the Blue Jays' comeback to tie the series shows the competitive nature of the American League playoff landscape.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are central to the ALCS narrative, having tied the series with the Mariners and now seeking a series lead, which makes their playoff trajectory a key subplot.

namedEntities.name: Max Scherzer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former MLB pitcher, currently playing in his 18th season
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Scherzer’s performance in Game 4 of the ALCS was pivotal, as he pitched effectively and contributed to the Blue Jays’ momentum and success.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: MLB player, known for his power-hitting
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Guerrero Jr. hit his fifth playoff home run in the game, contributing to the Blue Jays’ offensive surge in Game 4 of the ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Jacob Misiorowski
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Misiorowski had a standout performance, striking out nine and setting a Milwaukee rookie postseason record, which helped the Brewers hold off the Dodgers in the early innings.

namedEntities.name: Tommy Edman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Edman drove in the run that gave the Dodgers a lead in the sixth inning and expressed excitement about the team’s momentum heading into the final game of the NLCS.

namedEntities.name: Abner Uribe
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Uribe committed a throwing error that allowed Freddie Freeman to score, directly contributing to the Dodgers’ 3-1 lead.

namedEntities.name: Freddie Freeman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Freeman scored on a throwing error by Abner Uribe, helping the Dodgers take a 3-1 lead in the NLCS.

namedEntities.name: Cincinnati Reds
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Reds were the team the Dodgers faced in the wild card round, which the Dodgers narrowly defeated, marking a key step in their postseason journey.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Los Angeles Dodgers are one game away from securing their second consecutive World Series appearance after defeating the Milwaukee Brewers 3-1 in the National League Championship Series, with a 3-0 lead making them the first defending champion to reach the Series in 16 years. Meanwhile, in the American League Championship Series, the Toronto Blue Jays have tied the Seattle Mariners after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, shifting the momentum of the series. Key performances include Max Scherzer’s dominant pitching and Vladimir Guerrero Jr.’s fifth playoff home run, while Jacob Misiorowski’s nine-strikeout performance also stood out. The Dodgers’ path to the World Series appears nearly certain, with only the 2004 Boston Red Sox having come back from a 3-0 deficit. The Blue Jays now aim to take the series lead and advance to the World Series, setting up a potential matchup between the Dodgers and Blue Jays in the Fall Classic.
title: Dodgers close in on second straight World Series appearance, Blue Jays knot up ALCS against Mariners
